@graph.name: Semantic SEO Content Writing Guidelines
@graph.description: 14 essential guidelines for creating semantic SEO content that ranks well

itemListElement.name: Prioritize Key Attributes
itemListElement.description: Place the most important details or attributes early in sentences to match the user's search intent

itemListElement.name: Factual and Authoritative Language
itemListElement.description: Use declarative language. Avoid modal verbs like 'may,' 'might,' or 'should.' Focus on providing certain, factual information

itemListElement.name: Eliminate Unnecessary Words
itemListElement.description: Avoid fluff or redundant phrases. Ensure each word adds value and supports the main point

itemListElement.name: Use Numbers and Specificity
itemListElement.description: Always quantify claims with numbers or data where applicable. If listing items, give specific examples

itemListElement.name: Use Precise Verbs
itemListElement.description: Contextually match the correct verb for actions or processes. For instance, 'increase' for measurable aspects, 'improve' for quality or efficiency, and 'develop' for skills

itemListElement.name: Provide Examples with Plural Nouns
itemListElement.description: After listing numbers or categories, include specific examples to illustrate the point

itemListElement.name: Optimize Subordinate Text
itemListElement.description: Answer the user's query directly in the first sentence of each section or paragraph

itemListElement.name: Rearrange Conditional Statements
itemListElement.description: Place conditions (e.g., 'if' statements) after the main result or action for better clarity

itemListElement.name: Match Anchor Text to Page Titles
itemListElement.description: Ensure the anchor text matches the title of the linked content for improved SEO ranking

itemListElement.name: Format for Featured Snippets
itemListElement.description: Write concise, 30-40 word responses that directly answer questions in the first sentence, to optimize for featured snippets in search results

itemListElement.name: Bold Key Answers
itemListElement.description: Highlight important answers in bold to make them stand out to users and search engines

itemListElement.name: Support Claims with Data
itemListElement.description: Always back up factual statements with credible sources or statistics, particularly when making claims about trends, costs, or comparisons

itemListElement.name: Use Tables for Complex Data
itemListElement.description: When presenting comparative or detailed data, use tables for clarity and reader engagement

itemListElement.name: Use Bullets Where Appropriate
itemListElement.description: Structure information using bullet points for better readability and user engagement
